channel.title: How do I make a chest give random drops?
channel.description: Title says it ^^ Anyways, I want to make barrows chest give random rewards, I know I would use something like: misc.random, but im not sure what comes next. Can anybody help? I want there to be around 24 different rewards.

item.title: How do I make a chest give random drops?
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

if(UsedOnObjectID == 10687 && ItemID == BARROWSCHEST){ //BARROWS CHEST is where ID goes.
addItem(####, £); = #### - item id, £-how many of it.
sendMessage(“You find an item in the chest.”);
}

Read full topic

item.title: How do I make a chest give random drops?
item.dc:creator: @client_class client class
item.description:
@client_class wrote:

Si Force:

Add an extra ‘(’ at the start and ‘)’ at the end, should work.

Thanks, but now i get this:

client.java:25955: cannot find symbol
symbol  : method randomBarrow()
location: class client
addItem(randomBarrow(), 1);
        ^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
Note: server.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .

I also added this in Item2.java:

 public static int barrows[] = { 601, 758, 788, 983, 601, 601, 601, 5585};

    public static int randomBarrows() {
        return barrows[(int) (Math.random() * barrows.length)];
    }

I thought this was how it was supposed to be, i guess i was wrong

Read full topic

item.title: How do I make a chest give random drops?
item.dc:creator: @client_class client class
item.description:
@client_class wrote:

o.O O.o:

Trust me, I gave you a flawless case.

This is the whole case:

case 10284:
if playerHasItem(275) == true && playerHasItem(298) == true && playerHasItem(293) == true && playerHasItem(423) == true && playerHasItem(432) == true && playerHasItem(601) == true) {
{
deleteItem(275, getItemSlot(275), 1); //also FOUR times, which I'm too lazy to do
deleteItem(298, getItemSlot(298), 1); //also FOUR times, which I'm too lazy to do
deleteItem(293, getItemSlot(293), 1); //also FOUR times, which I'm too lazy to do
deleteItem(423, getItemSlot(423), 1); //also FOUR times, which I'm too lazy to do
deleteItem(432, getItemSlot(432), 1); //also FOUR times, which I'm too lazy to do
deleteItem(601, getItemSlot(601), 1); //also FOUR times, which I'm too lazy to do
sendMessage("You get a random barrows item!");
addItem(randomBarrow(), 1);
}
break;

I get 100 errors on this one

item.title: How do I make a chest give random drops?
item.dc:creator: @client_class client class
item.description:
@client_class wrote:

[quote=“o.O O.o, post:4, topic:281410”]If you have four of them, and they’re not stackable? Not too sure, but try:

case #: if(playerHasItem(#)) //Write that FOUR times; I'm too lazy { deleteItem(#, getItemSlot(#), 1); //also FOUR times, which I'm too lazy to do sendMessage("You get a random barrow item!"); addItem(randomBarrow(), 1); } break;[/quote]

alright, thx, im gonna try

EDIT: Ok, this is what i got:

case 10284:
if playerHasItem(275) == true && playerHasItem(298) == true && playerHasItem(293) == true && playerHasItem(423) == true && playerHasItem(432) == true && playerHasItem(601) == true {
{
deleteItem(275, getItemSlot(275), 1); //also FOUR times, which I'm too lazy to do
deleteItem(298, getItemSlot(298), 1); //also FOUR times, which I'm too lazy to do
deleteItem(293, getItemSlot(293), 1); //also FOUR times, which I'm too lazy to do
deleteItem(423, getItemSlot(423), 1); //also FOUR times, which I'm too lazy to do
deleteItem(432, getItemSlot(432), 1); //also FOUR times, which I'm too lazy to do
deleteItem(601, getItemSlot(601), 1); //also FOUR times, which I'm too lazy to do
sendMessage("You get a random barrows item!");
addItem(randomBarrow(), 1);
}
break;

And for the “randomBarrow” I think I know what I need to do, I just put it into item2.java like a regular drop?

If you have four of them, and they’re not stackable? Not too sure, but try:

case #: if(playerHasItem(#)) //Write that FOUR times; I'm too lazy { deleteItem(#, getItemSlot(#), 1); //also FOUR times, which I'm too lazy to do sendMessage("You get a random barrow item!"); addItem(randomBarrow(), 1); } break;

item.title: How do I make a chest give random drops?
item.dc:creator: @client_class client class
item.description:
@client_class wrote:

o.O O.o:

Rather than using misc.random, create an array, and an int that returns one random value of that array, and use that int for addItem(int, 1); inside of the statement for using an item with an object. Understand me?

Not really. Anyways, I mean like, if you click on the chest with these 4 keys you get a random reward out of 24.
